intro: Sida platycalyx, commonly known as the broad-leaved sida, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant features palmately lobed leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and along stream banks.
